questions.question: Which of the following is NOT a main classification of nutritional disorders?
Marasmus in children is primarily caused by a deficiency of:
options: Simultaneous deficiency of proteins and calories

questions.question: Kwashiorkor typically occurs in children due to a diet that is:
options: High in protein, low in starch
Low in protein, high in starch
High in both protein and calories

questions.question: Which of the following is a clinical feature of Marasmus?
options: Severe muscle wasting and no subcutaneous fat

questions.question: Which type of anemia is microcytic and hypochromic?
Rickets is caused by a deficiency of:
Which of the following is a predisposing factor for Protein-Energy Malnutrition (PEM)?
options: Prolonged breastfeeding with faulty weaning practices
High protein supplementation from an early age

questions.question: Osteomalacia is the adult equivalent of which childhood deficiency disease?
Which laboratory finding is characteristic of iron deficiency anemia?
Megaloblastic anemia can be caused by deficiency of:
Which of the following is a symptom of iron deficiency anemia?
What is a common feature in both Marasmus and Kwashiorkor?
Which of the following prevents rickets?
options: Vitamin D supplementation and sunlight exposure

questions.question: Nutritional anemias are mainly due to deficiency of:
Which group is most vulnerable to nutritional deficiencies?
A child with a distended abdomen, edema, and hair changes most likely has:
Which is NOT a cause of undernutrition?
The earliest physical sign of rickets is often:
Prevention of PEM includes:
Which condition is characterized by bone pain and waddling gait in adults?
Folate deficiency anemia is often due to:
Which is a feature of Vitamin B12 deficiency anemia?
Which of the following is a cause of megaloblastic anemia?
What is a key difference between Marasmus and Kwashiorkor?
options: Marasmus has edema, Kwashiorkor does not
Kwashiorkor has edema, Marasmus does not

questions.question: Which of the following is NOT a symptom of rickets?
What is the primary cause of iron deficiency anemia?
options: Deficient intake of iron and chronic blood loss

questions.question: Which vitamin deficiency causes both megaloblastic anemia and neurological symptoms?
What is the main pathological feature in osteomalacia?
Which of the following is a prevention strategy for nutritional anemias?
options: Nutrition education and treatment of parasitic infections

questions.question: In PEM, which factor increases vulnerability?
Malnutrition includes both undernutrition and overnutrition.
Marasmus is commonly associated with edema.
Kwashiorkor occurs mainly in the first year of life.
Iron deficiency anemia is macrocytic and hyperchromic.
Rickets can be prevented by adequate sunlight exposure and vitamin D intake.
Osteomalacia is caused by a deficiency of vitamin C.
Megaloblastic anemia is due to iron deficiency.
PEM in adults can be caused by anorexia and malabsorption.
Nutritional disorders only refer to deficiencies, not excesses.
Folate deficiency anemia is commonly seen in individuals with poor vegetable intake.
